abstract.p: Barneys New York senior executives Catherine Nguyen, Emilia Fabricant, Lisa Gorevitz and Julie Levy are resigning and will be moving to Eve.com, Internet retailer specializing in beauty products (S)

block.p: Four senior executives of Barneys New York said yesterday that they were resigning, a move that could signal a new round of trouble for the fashion retailer.
The four executives said that they would all be moving to Eve.com, an Internet retailer specializing in beauty products.
Four senior executives of Barneys New York said yesterday that they were resigning, a move that could signal a new round of trouble for the fashion retailer.
The four executives said that they would all be moving to Eve.com, an Internet retailer specializing in beauty products.
Eve is financed by Idealab, the same Internet incubator behind Etoys Inc. and NetZero Inc. Its chief executive is the former Barneys chief executive, Thomas Shull.

Among those departing Barneys are Catherine Nguyen, who had been vice president and a divisional merchandise manager, and Emilia Fabricant, a senior vice president. The other executives who left were Lisa Gorevitz and Julie Levy.

Barney's Inc., which filed for bankruptcy in 1996, is now owned and run by two companies specializing in distressed properties, Whippoorwill Associates of White Plains and Bay Harbour Management of New York.
Last May, they hired Allen Questrom, the former chief executive of Federated Department Stores, to act as the chairman and chief executive of Barneys.
